meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a parody.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a parodical scene that made fun of famous superheroes.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's parodical imitation of the president was hilarious.
meanings.sent3: The parodical skit about a clumsy superhero had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her parodical take on the classic fairy tale was both clever and entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The parodical nature of the play added a unique twist to the familiar story.

meanings.sent1: The painting had a parodical style that mimicked famous artworks.
meanings.sent2: The book's parodical cover art hinted at the humorous content inside.
meanings.sent3: His parodical fashion sense always turned heads at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: The parodical advertisement cleverly spoofed popular commercials.
meanings.sent5: The parodical tone of the article made it stand out among serious news stories.

meanings.definition: In the style of a parody.
meanings.sent1: The play had a parodical script that poked fun at traditional fairy tales.
meanings.sent2: The song's parodical lyrics added a comedic element to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The parodical dance routine brought a lighthearted touch to the competition.
meanings.sent4: The parodical artwork cleverly blended famous paintings with a modern twist.
meanings.sent5: The parodical nature of the comedy show appealed to a wide audience.
